Well, I made chili which was nothing but stew meat, broth and seasonings. It cooked down but still soup. I added sour cream and cheese to the bowl. It thickened up a good bit.
Keith Watkins that sounds really good. What kind of seasonings?
Susan Gallant stuff that makes chili mix. Chili powder, powdered garlic and onion, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, etc.

Ground meat with bone broth, sour cream, cheddar cheese, spices if you tolerate.
I think someone on this page also made clam chowder with clams, heavy whipping cream, bacon and butter. It is SO good.

I make egg drop soup in beef bone broth very heavy on the egg. Season it with some good Celtic sea salt and my body literally craves it!
Blend beef tendon into your bone broth. It makes a thick creamy texture that is good for soups, stews and gravies.
